title: Analyzing EU Funding Data with eufundr
text: vignette demonstrates use eufundr package download publicly available EU funding data multiple sources

what: Download all data for Finland from all sources
title: Analyzing EU Funding Data with eufundr
text: Access specific parts
code: all_data <- get_all_data("FI") projects <- all_data$kohesio_projects beneficiaries <- all_data$kohesio_beneficiaries fts <- all_data$fts horizon2020 <- all_data$horizon_2020 horizon_europe <- all_data$horizon_europe interreg <- all_data$interreg

what: Download only certain country and sources
title: Analyzing EU Funding Data with eufundr
text: Get Greek kohesio projects Get Romanian kohesio beneficiaries Get Dutch FTS data year 2024 Get Swedish Horizon data Get Danish h2020 data Get German interreg data
code: kohesio_projects = get_kohesio_projects(country = "GR") kohesio_beneficiaries = get_kohesio_beneficiaries(country = "RO") fts = get_fts_data(year = 2024, country =  "NL") horizon = get_horizon_data(programme = "HORIZON", country = "SE") h2020 = get_horizon_data(programme = "h2020", country = "DK") interreg = get_interreg_data(country = "DE")

title: eufundr
text: eufundr R package downloading publicly available EU funding data multiple official sources: Kohesio: comprehensive database EU Cohesion Policy projects beneficiaries. portal brings together information 1.5 million projects across Europe, including funding sources, amounts, implementing organizations. enables users track EU regional structural funds invested different member states. information open data: https://kohesio.ec.europa.eu/en/data. FTS: Financial Transparency System provides detailed information EU budget expenditures beneficiaries. includes data recipients EU funding, amounts granted, related programmes across multiple years. system promotes transparency accountability use EU public funds. information open data: https://ec.europa.eu/budget/financial-transparency-system/help.html#download-data CORDIS: EU’s research innovation funding programmes supporting scientific excellence, collaboration, technological development across Europe. CORDIS portal provides information projects, funding, participants, outcomes, covering ongoing completed initiatives. information open data: https://cordis.europa.eu/projects Interreg: database containing approved contracted Interreg IPA cross-border cooperation projects. also includes projects funded EU instruments funds contributing macro-regional strategies (2020). portal offers comprehensive overview EU territorial cooperation initiatives. information open data: https://keep.eu package uses data served web page API. Also documentation data somewhere web pages. One use case data loading tool download data exploration, example, check whether beneficiary (company organization) double-funded. Users can explore company IDs, company names, project names, project descriptions dataset. data can help answer questions : ‘purpose company receive funding?’ ‘companies received grants, purposes?’

title: eufundr
text: order use package need R version 4.1 newer remotes-package installed. new R using R code please see https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/starting.html instructions.

title: eufundr
text: get_all_data() function one gets data single country, set countries available countries (country parameter set) sources documented . Country filter approves ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes. See list: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements Function returns named list “kohesio_projects” element data.frame kohesio projects question “kohesio_beneficiaries” element data.frame kohesio beneficiaries question “fts” element data.frame fts data question “horizon” element data.frame horizon data question “interreg” element list interreg data question: partners data.frame projects data.frame get Greek specific kohesio projects data.frame One random example: get Romanian specific beneficiaries data.frame One random example: get Dutch specific FTS data year 2024 data.frame One random example: Get Swedish Horizon data data.frame One random example: Get Portugese Interreg data list One random example partners data.frame One random example projects data.frame

title: eufundr
text: eufundr R package downloading publicly available EU funding data multiple official sources: Kohesio: comprehensive database EU Cohesion Policy projects beneficiaries. portal brings together information 1.5 million projects across Europe, including funding sources, amounts, implementing organizations. enables users track EU regional structural funds invested different member states. information open data: https://kohesio.ec.europa.eu/en/data. FTS: Financial Transparency System provides detailed information EU budget expenditures beneficiaries. includes data recipients EU funding, amounts granted, related programmes across multiple years. system promotes transparency accountability use EU public funds. information open data: https://ec.europa.eu/budget/financial-transparency-system/help.html#download-data CORDIS: CORDIS: EU’s research innovation funding programmes supporting scientific excellence, collaboration, technological development across Europe (Horizon Europe Horizon 2020 datasets). CORDIS portal provides information projects, funding, participants, outcomes, covering ongoing completed initiatives. information open data: https://cordis.europa.eu/projects Interreg: database containing approved contracted Interreg IPA cross-border cooperation projects. also includes projects funded EU instruments funds contributing macro-regional strategies (2020). portal offers comprehensive overview EU territorial cooperation initiatives. information open data: https://keep.eu package uses data served web page API. Also documentation data somewhere web pages. One use case data loading tool download data exploration, example, check whether beneficiary (company organization) double-funded. Users can explore company IDs, company names, project names, project descriptions dataset. data can help answer questions : ‘purpose company receive funding?’ ‘companies received grants, purposes?’

title: eufundr
text: order use package need R version 4.1 newer remotes-package installed. new R using R code please see https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/starting.html instructions.
